front.div:
a b s t r a c t
This paper describes a new technology to produce biopolymer composites at room temperature. During
the process, micrometer-scale raw material is coated with zein that has strong adhesive property, which
is then compressed to form a rigid material. Since this technology does not require purification of the raw
materials, various types of compounds can be used as component materials. The coating of particles with
zein makes use of the unique property of zein in aqueous ethanol solution. Zein molecules adsorb to the
surface of hydrophilic particles when the ethanol content of solvent mixture increases. Formation of
aggregates is followed to form large agglomerates. Removal of solvents from the agglomerates yields
the final product. Biopolymer composites thus formed showed a broad range of compressive strengths
depending on the hardness of the starting raw material used as a base component.
